meanings.definition: A large citrus fruit with a thick rind and fragrant, acidic pulp.
meanings.sent1: The citron on the tree looked ripe and ready to be picked.
meanings.sent2: She sliced the citron and added it to the salad for a burst of flavor.
meanings.sent3: The citron rolled off the table and caused a fruity mess on the floor.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was as bright and refreshing as a citron on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent5: The scent of the citron filled the room, making everyone crave a taste.

meanings.definition: A small tree or shrub that produces citrons.
meanings.sent1: The citron in the garden bore ripe fruits every season.
meanings.sent2: The farmer planted a new citron next to the lemon tree.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel climbed the citron tree and stole some fruits.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as vibrant and fruitful as a citron tree in bloom.
meanings.sent5: The leaves of the citron rustled in the breeze, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: A yellow color resembling that of a citron fruit.
meanings.sent1: She painted her room in a lovely citron shade.
meanings.sent2: The artist mixed yellow and white to create a beautiful citron hue.
meanings.sent3: His bright citron shirt stood out among the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The citron glow of the sunset painted the sky in warm colors.
meanings.sent5: The citron color of the walls brought a cheerful vibe to the room.
